problem_summary_simple: Find the earliest day all flowers bloom, given planting and growing times.
problem_summary_technical: Greedily schedule planting by sorting seeds by decreasing growTime to minimize the latest bloom day.
key_insights: The optimal strategy is to plant the seeds that take the longest to grow first.
This greedy approach ensures that the longest growing periods are accounted for earliest, minimizing the overall completion time.
The total time is determined by the maximum of (current planting completion time + grow time) for each seed.
